defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: UNITE, the Union of Needle Trades, Industrial, and Textile Employees was formed in 1995 after a merger between the International Ladies' Garment Workers Union (ILGWU) and the Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union (ACTWU).
In 2004 they announced they would merge with the Hotel Employees and Restaurant Employees Union (HERE) which created UNITE HERE.
Jay Mazur served as president of UNITE from its beginning until his retirement in 2001. Bruce Raynor was elected president at that time and served until the HERE merger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection has over 12,000 photographs, 400 slides and several CD's of photographs documenting the history of UNITE.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: UNITE Photographs #6000 P. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 6000/016 P: UNITE Local 169 Amalgamated Northeast Regional Joint Board Photographs 6000/018 P: UNITE Pacific Northwest District Council Photographs 6000/024 P: UNITE Local 23-25 Photographs 6000/033 P: UNITE Local 155 Photographs 6000/037 P: UNITE Communications Department Photographs 6000/043 P: UNITE Editor Photographs 6000/044 P: UNITE Photographs 6000/049 P: UNITE Local 9 Photographs 6000/050 P: UNITE Local 10 and Local 23-25 Photographs
